get.description:
Returns a list of GenIT properties that are the usage settings for the GenIT service. The properties consist of Boolean values to indicate which providers and tag types to use, how many associative search classes to generate and the minimum confidence threshold used for the most general associative search class. There are default properties that are used in the general case, and there can be individual customer properties.

Each property contains scope field which indicates if the property value is default or customer specific.

  • DEFAULT - default value
  • CUSTOMER_SPECIFIC - customer specific value
     /rest/mp/v1.0/ai-administration/properties
__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_ORGANISATION_MANAGE_MP_SEARCH_CONFIGURATION

403.description: User has no rights to use AI service.

409.description: The system is not registered.

500.description: Internal server error occurred (timeout or any other).

503.description: AI service is disabled on this system.

get.description:
Returns the state of the service, as well as it's progress.

Example response:

     {
         "currentState": "RUNNING",
         "processedItems": 2150,
         "totalItems": 2326
     }
__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_ORGANISATION_MANAGE_MP_SEARCH_CONFIGURATION

200.description: The AI tagging progress is returned.

403.description: The user does not have rights to view the service state

503.description: AI Tagging is not enabled on this system.

post.description:
Update the state of the AI tagging service. Returns the new state of the service.

The following state transitions are allowed:

  • From RUNNING to STOPPED - Stops AI tagging.
  • From STOPPED/FINISHED to RUNNING - Starts AI tagging of all assets that are NOT successfully tagged yet
     /rest/mp/v1.1/ai-tagging

Request parameter example:

     {
        "state": "RUNNING"
     }

Response example:

     {
        "currentState": "RUNNING"
     }
__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_ORGANISATION_MANAGE_MP_SEARCH_CONFIGURATION

requestBody.description: the new state of the service

200.description: The AI Tagging state has been updated.

403.description: The user does not have the rights to perform the state transition

409.description: Transition to the new state can not be performed from the current state

503.description: AI Tagging is not enabled on this system.

post.description:
Create a custom attribute type based on @type property. The following types are available:
  • boolean
  • color
  • date
  • dateRange
  • dateTime
  • decimal
    • precision default value is 2
    • decimalMinValue and decimalMaxValue are limited to 11 digits before and 5 after decimal point. Their values should respect the given precision.
  • formattedText
    • min length's default value is 1
    • max length's default value is 25000
    • number of lines default value is 5
  • html
  • integer
  • link
  • multiSelect
  • plainText
    • min length's default value is 1
    • max length's default value is 25000
    • number of lines default value is 1
  • singleSelect
  • time
  • timeRange
A type has specific properties but all types shares name, shortName and helpText which are multilingual (accepts collection of pairs language:value). __Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_ORGANISATION_MANAGE_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTES

'true' - language names, 'false' - language tags.

get.description:
Returns mass imports' details according to the paging, filters and sorting parameters. 
 Result example:
 {
       "totalCount": 25,
       "massImports": [
           {
               "id": 87,
               "name": "Noch aufzuarbeiten",
               "ownerId": 0,
               "ownerUuid": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001".
               "ownerName": "Admin, BrandMaker",
               "lastUploadDate": "2013-01-22T15:10:55Z",
               "assetsCount": 2,
               "waitingAssetsCount": 0,
               "status": "AUTOMATIC"
           },
           {
               "id": 488,
               "name": "Upload 02.08.2017 14:23",
               "ownerId": 15,
               "ownerUuid": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002",
               "ownerName": "Support, BrandMaker",
               "lastUploadDate": "2017-08-02T14:23:54Z",
               "assetsCount": 0,
               "waitingAssetsCount": 0,
               "status": "READY"
           }
       ]
  }
Note that 'totalCount' is calculated according to the current filters! __Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

parameters.name: completionState
parameters.description: one of 'ALL' and 'UNCOMPLETED'; Default: 'ALL' ('UNCOMPLETED' i.e. mass-import is not empty and contains only waiting assets)

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: filters according to last-upload-date (lower limit); Inclusive; LocalDate; Optional

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: max results; Number; Default: 10

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: filters according to mass imports' names as sub-string; Case-insensitive; String; Optional

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: result offset; Number; Default: 0

parameters.name: onlyOwn
parameters.description: if 'true' returns only mass imports to which user is owner (when 'false' depends on SEE_ALL_MASSIMPORTS user right); Boolean; Default: 'true;

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: one of: 'name', 'owner' and 'lastUploadDate'; Default: 'lastUploadDate'

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: one of: 'asc' and 'desc'; Default: 'desc'

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: filters according to last-upload-date (upper limit); Inclusive; LocalDate; Optional

requestBody.description:
multipart form data message that contains a file with associated name - "uploadFile", "comment" (Optional) and "workflowStepsData" (Optional) that is a list of WorkflowStepToUserRestDto 
 [
    {
       "stepId":2,
       "userId":1701,
       "userUuid":"00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001"
    },
    {
       "stepId":1,
       "userId":71,
       "userUuid":"00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002"
    }
 ]
Available workflow data for this asset can be taken from /rest/mp/v1.0/assets/{assetId}/workflow-steps
Internal codes:
E - Error, W - Warning, I - Info
MP_E01001 - An asset with that ID doesn't exist.
MP_E01002 - Asset ID is invalid.
MP_E01003 - Insufficient access rights.
MP_E02001 - The filename is empty or the file is missing.
MP_E02002 - The file extension is currently not supported. Params: suffix
MP_E02003 - Invalid file size. Params: file name
MP_E02004 - Please select a person for approval.
MP_E02005 - The asset already exists. Params: file name, asset ID
MP_E02006 - Indesign containing invalid fonts. Params: file name
MP_E02007 - An error has occurred during upload.
MP_E02008 - Another user is currently uploading a new version at the same time.
MP_W02001 - Asset version is imported but the preview generation failed MP_I02001 - This PDF file is password protected.

400.description: One or more of asset id, suffix, file size, workflow steps data (Optional) are not valid

404.description: No asset found with such id

409.description: Duplicate file or the file is indesign containing invalid fonts

post.description:
Delete (bulk) assets The "green" assets (those with all mandatory fields filled in and visible in search) will be sent to the Recycle Bin; The "red" assets will be completely deleted Validation is checking if assets are allowed to be deleted based on their state so it is possible that asset can't be deleted even if the user has the rights to do it. The allowed assets will be deleted, error will be returned in the response for unallowed or unsuccessful ones 
 Example:
 /rest/mp/v1.0/assets/_delete

 Example request payload:
 {
     "assetIds":[
          123, 456, 1112
     ],
     "variantsHandler": {
          "type" : "TRANSFER_VARIANTS",
          "transferToAssetId": 2222
     }
 }
__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

207.description: There are errors during the deletion process

400.description: Input data (Asset IDs, variant handler) validation failed

403.description: User does not have the rights to execute the operation

post.description:
Loads assets by a given collection of pair <assetId, versionNumber> and a loadMask. The loadMask is used to load the requested external properties of the AssetRestDto. The returned response contains 2 collections. The first collection assets contains all assets which are found and are contained in the request. The second collection statuses contains status objects for each not-found asset and asset resource version. If the client does not provide versionNumber for any if the requested assets, the response will contains an entry with the requested asset and its latest version.

Maximum 200 assets can be requested via this endpoint. If you request more than 200 assets a BAD_REQUEST response will be returned.

If any of the given arguments - assetId or versionNumber is missing, BAD_REQUEST is returned as this is invalid request.

If the load mask is omitted, the response will contains the found assets with no loaded relations to them, ie. no variants or themes. expandable (String, Optional) vdb,license,language,variants,countries,customProperties,persons, downloadApproval,themes,watchers,relations,structuredKeywords,uploadApproval, division,channelPublications,owner,customAttributes __Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

parameters.name: useLanguageNamesResult

requestBody.description: a wrapper over the collection of assetId and versionNumber, both non-negative integers and the expand parameter

200.description: All requested assets and resource version numbers have been found.

207.description: Request completed but with errors, check the statuses collection for individual errors.

put.description:
Deletes asset with the given id.

/rest/mp/assets/{assetId}/state

      Example:
      /rest/mp/assets/74568/state
  
         {
            "state": "DELETED",
            "variantsHandler": {
                 "type": "TRANSFER_VARIANTS",
                 "transferToAssetId": 74569
            }
         }
__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

parameters.name: assetId
parameters.description: (Integer, non-negative) the id of asset to be removed.

requestBody.description:
(Required) The required state change. JSON representation AssetStateChangeRestDto
  • state - (Required) The new state of the asset.
    • DELETED - delete the asset
  • variantsHandler - (Optional) The strategy for handling the deleted asset's variants when DELETED state is requested. When missing, UNASSIGN_VARIANTS will be assumed.
    • type - String, one of:
      • TRANSFER_VARIANTS - all variants will be transferred to the asset specified by transferToAssetId
      • UNASSIGN_VARIANTS - all variants will be unassigned
      • DELETE_VARIANTS - all variants that the user has access to will be deleted
    • transferToAssetId - Integer, Non-negative. The ID of the asset to which the deleted asset's variants will be transfered. Required only when TRANSFER_VARIANTS type is selected.

400.description: Asset ID is missing or is a negative integer. stateChange or state are missing.  transferToAssetId is required and is missing or is a negative number.

403.description: User is not allowed to delete this asset. User can not transfer variants from this asset to the one specified by transferToAssetId.

404.description: Asset with the given ID does not exist. The asset with transferToAssetId is requried but does not exist.

409.description: Asset specified by transferToAssetId is variant

                 "propertyName": "categories",
                 "values": [ 12, 23 ]
             },
             {
                 "@type": "replace_vdb",
                 "propertyName": "vdb",
                 "value": {
                     "vdbId": 1402,
                     "vdbUuid: "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001",
                     "workflowSteps": [
                         {
                             "stepId": 1,
                             "userId": 1701,

                         },
                         {
                             "stepId": 2,
                             "userId": 1111,
                             "userUuid": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002"
                         }
                     ]
                 }
             },
             {
                 "@type": "replace_download_approval",
                 "propertyName": "downloadApproval",
                 "value": {
                     "requiresApproval": true,
                     "approvalDescription": {
                         "en": "aaa",
                         "de": "bbb"
                     }
                 }
             }
        ]
     }
  • assetIds (integer collection, MANDATORY) - specifies the ids of the assets to be updated. Id's count must be between 1 and 500 (inclusive)
  • errorHandlingStrategy (String, MANDATORY) - specifies what should be done in case one or more of the assets can not be updated either because the update will leave it in invalid state or because of lack of privileges
    • FAIL_ON_ERROR - If one or more assets fail to update then none of the assets will be updated.
    • UPDATE_VALID_ENTITIES - The assets that can be updated will be updated. Other assets will be unaffected.
  • updateOperations (update operation objects collection, MANDATORY) - the update operations to be performed on the specified assets.
    • @type (String, MANDATORY) - type of the operation to be performed. One of:
      • add_int - add integer items to a collection field
      • add_string - add string items to a collection field
      • remove_int - remove integer items from a collection field. There is no values validation!
      • remove_string - remove string items from a collection field. There is no values validation!
      • remove_simple - remove the value of a simple field
      • replace_boolean - replace the value of a simple field with the specified boolean value
      • replace_date - replace the value of a simple field with the specified date value. Date format: yyyy-MM-dd
      • replace_daterange - replace the value of a simple field with the specified date values. Date format: yyyy-MM-dd
      • replace_datetime - replace the value of a simple field with the specified datetime value. Datetime format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z (ISO 8601)
      • replace_datetimerange - replace the value of a simple field with the specified datetime values. Datetime format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z (ISO 8601)
      • replace_decimal - replace the value of a simple field with the specified decimal value. Decimal separator: . (dot)
      • replace_download_approval - replace the values of a simple field with download approval data - requiresApproval and approvalDescription
      • replace_int - replace the value of a simple field with the specified integer value
      • replace_multilang - replace the value of a simple field with the specified multilanguage value
      • replace_string - replace the value of a simple field with the specified string value
      • replace_time - replace the value of a simple field with the specified time value. Time format: HH:mm:ss
      • replace_timerange - replace the value of a simple field with the specified time values. Time format: HH:mm:ss
      • replace_vdb - replace the value of a vdb field with specific vbd id and workflow steps data if required
      • append_multilang - append the specified multilanguage value to the existing one (language by language)
      • append_string - append the specified string value to the existing one
    • propertyName (String, MANDATORY) - the field to be updated by this operation. Must be one of the fields in the partial update schema
    • values (array) - this property is available only for the add_int, add_string, remove_int, remove_string - specifies the integer/string items to be added/removed from the collection field (must not be null/empty).
    • value - this property is available only for the replace_* operation types. Specifies the value to be set for the specified field and can never be null! Unsetting a value should be done by using the remove_simple operation type. The value property must conform to the following restrictions:
      • Can not be null!
      • Must be a boolean value when replace_boolean operation type is used!
      • Must be an integer value when replace_int operation type is used!
      • Must be a string value when replace_string or append_string operation types are used!
      • Must be a multilanguage value when replace_multilang or append_multilang operation types are used! Multilang values are key-value pairs where the key is the language code and the value is the value for the respective language. E.g.: 
                              {
                          "EN": "Value for english",
                          "FR": "Value for french"
                      }
      • Must be a date value when the replace_date operation type is used!
      • Must be a date with time value when the replace_date_time operation type is used!
      • Must be a time value when the replace_time operation type is used!
      • When the replace_vdb operation type is used must contains an integer vdb value (vdbId) and workflow steps data (workflowSteps - if needed) related to this vdb - steps and approvers of a workflow attached to this virtual database
      • The value also must conform to the restriction described in the schema for the respective field!
    • valueStart and valueEnd - those properties are available only for the range operation types - replace_daterange, replace_datetimerange, replace_timerange. At least one of the properties must be not null. Unsetting a value should be done by using the remove_simple operation type (remove the whole range).
  • String fields: affiliateId, fileName, isins, itemNumber, language, platform, programVersion, custom attribute color, custom attribute html, custom attribute link
  • Integer fields: alternativePreview, assetType (specifying the set of fields), license, custom attribute integer, custom attribute single select
  • Boolean fields: editState (forcing the asset to become green), hideIfNotValid, hiRes, suitableForW2P, custom attribute boolean
  • Date fields: custom attribute single date
  • Date range fields: assetValidity, custom attribute date range
  • Datetime fields: custom attribute date and time
  • Decimal fields: custom attribute decimal number
  • Multilanguage fields: assetTitle, description, itemDescription, tags, custom attribute formatted text, custom attribute text
  • Time fields: custom attribute time
  • Time range fields: custom attribute time range
  • Collection fields: categories (integer), countries (string), keywords (integer), persons (integer), custom attribute multiselect
  • Fields with own operation type: downloadApproval, vdb
__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
container for json representation of input collection of SearchFilterRestDto 
    [
    {
        "type": "THEME_ID",
        "value": [
        {
            "search": "0"
        }
        ]
    }
    ]
  • type (String) - name of the filter
    • KEYWORD
      • Valid values: Non empty strings
    • STRUCTURED_KEYWORD_ID
      • Valid values: Integers, ids of existing structured keywords
    • THEME_ID
      • Valid values: Integers, ids of existing themes
    • COLOR_SPACE
      • Valid values: Integers in the range [0, 3] where:
      • 0 - undefined colorspace
      • 1 - RGB colorspace
      • 2 - Grayscale colorspace
      • 3 - CMYK colorspace
    • COUNTRY_ID
      • Valid values: Non null strings, country codes. Empty string stands for "no country".
    • LANGUAGE_ID
      • Valid values: Non null strings, ids of existing languages. Empty string stands for "no language".
    • SUFFIX
      • Valid values: Non empty strings
    • VDB_ID
      • Valid values: Integers, ids of existing VDBs
    • RATING
      • Search by minimum rating. Valid values: Floats in the range [1, 5]
    • LICENSE_TYPE
      • Valid values: Strings. Empty string represents "No license"
    • IS_CURRENTLY_PUBLISHED
      • Valid values: Booleans
    • LICENSE_VALIDITY
      • Valid value: Two dates in the 'yyyy-MM-dd' format representing from and to endpoints respectively. Any of the dates may be null representing no restriction on the respective endpoint.
    • PUBLISH_DATE
      • Valid value: Two dates in the 'yyyy-MM-dd' format representing from and to endpoints respectively. Any of the dates may be null representing no restriction on the respective endpoint.
    • DOCUMENT_DIMENSIONS
      • Valid values: Should always contain exactly 5 values
      1. Unit type (Integer) - one of:
        • 1 - pixels
        • 2 - centimeters
        • 3 - millimeters
        • 4 - points
        • 5 - inches
      2. Width from (Integer, Optional) - null represents no minimum width
      3. Width to (Integer, Optional) - null represents no maximum width
      4. Height from (Integer, Optional) - null represents no minimum height
      5. Height to (Integer, Optional) - null represents no maximum height
    • FILE_SIZE
      • Valid value: Two integers representing from and to endpoints respectively (in KB). Any of the integers may be null representing no restriction on the respective endpoint.
    • UPLOAD_DATE
      • Valid value: Two dates in the 'yyyy-MM-dd' format representing from and to endpoints respectively. Any of the dates may be null representing no restriction on the respective endpoint.
    • ASSET_VALIDITY
      • Valid value: Two dates in the 'yyyy-MM-dd' format representing from and to endpoints respectively. Any of the dates may be null representing no restriction on the respective endpoint.
  • value - array of value objects
    • search (String) - filter value

parameters.description:
container for json representation of input collection of SortCriteriaRestDto 
    [
    {
        "field": "_score",
        "order": "DESC",
        "missing": null
    },
    {
        "field": "UPLOAD_DATE",
        "order": "DESC",
        "missing": null
    }
    ]

    • _score (relevance)
    • UPLOAD_DATE - configurable
    • LAST_UPDATED
    • TITLE - configurable
    • FILE_SIZE - configurable
    • POPULARITY
    • RATING - configurable
  • order (String) - asc/desc
  • missing (String) (Optional, Default: null)- Sets the value when a field is missing. Can also be set to _last or _first to sort missing last or first respectively.

get.description:
Get all assets (ids) that the current user is subscribed to

/rest/mp/subscribers/assets

__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

post.description:
Subscribe assets to the current user

/rest/mp/subscribers/assets

__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

requestBody.description:
List of asset Id parameters (Integers, Non-negative). 
  [123, 456, 789]

400.description: Asset id is missing or invalid

404.description: Asset id is not available

delete.description:
Unsubscribe assets from the current user if asset ids are provided, otherwise unsubscribe all assets from the current user

/rest/mp/subscribers/assets

__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

requestBody.description:
List of asset Id parameters (Integers, Non-negative).
[123, 456, 789]

404.description: Asset ids are not available

get.description:
Check if the current user is subscribed to an asset

/rest/mp/subscribers/{assetId}

     /rest/mp/subscribers/assets/12345
__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

parameters.name: assetId
parameters.description: (Integer, Non-negative) - Asset id

404.description: Asset id is not available

get.description:
Returns list of suggestions for the searched string. 
     Example:
     /rest/mp/suggest?query=test&lang=en&limit=25
__Available Since:__ 8.0.0 __Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: (String) An ISO 639 language code or language tag that will be used for result data. (Optional, Default: Current user language code)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: (Integer) number of the returned results ( Optional, Default : 10 )

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: (String) search string (Optional, empty result will be returned when missing)

parameters.name: useLanguageNamesResult
parameters.description:
(boolean, Optional, Default: true) Define languages format in the result.
'true' - language names, 'false' - language tags.

200.description: A list with suggestions is returned.

parameters.name: orgUnit
parameters.description: integer

parameters.name: roleUuid
parameters.description: role UUID

parameters.name: useLanguageNamesResult
parameters.description:
(boolean, Optional, Default: true) Define languages format in the result.
'true' - language names, 'false' - language tags.

post.description:
Create an asset type. Property name required. Asset type group is created with associated system attributes.

  {
      "name":{
          "en":"name en",
          "de":"name de"
      },
      "description":{
          "en":"description en",
          "de":"description de"
      },
      "orgUnitIds": [
          1,2,3
      ],
      "orgUnitUuids": [
          "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001"
      ],
      "roleUuids": [
          "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001",
          "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002"
      ]
  }
__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_ORGANISATION_MANAGE_ASSET_TYPES

parameters.name: useLanguageNamesResult
parameters.description:
(boolean, Optional, Default: true) Define languages format in the result.
'true' - language names, 'false' - language tags.

requestBody.description: AssetTypeCreateRestDto

409.description: asset type state conflicts with the request

patch.description:
Create, update or delete asset type's groups and attribute configuration. Visible and editable default values - true, mandatory - false Default value can be set only to the following attribute types:
  • boolean attribute type - @type boolean
  • color attribute type - @type text
  • dateRanger attribute type - @type dateRange
  • dateTime attribute type - @type dateTime
  • date attribute type - @type date
  • decimal attribute type - @type decimal
  • formattedText attribute type - @type jsonText
  • html attribute type - @type text
  • integer attribute type - @type integer
  • link attribute type - @type text
  • multiSelect attribute type - @type nodeFK
  • plainText attribute type - @type jsonText
  • singleSelect attribute type - @type nodeFK
  • time attribute type - @type time
  • timeRange attribute type - @type timeRange
  • countries attribute type - @type text
  • language attribute type - @type integer
  • w2pClassification attribute type - @type integer
  • categories attribute type - @type integer
  • vdb attribute type - @type integer
  • suitableForW2P attribute type - @type boolean
Validation of input data:
  • group name required
  • group position required and must be unique for the asset type
  • same groupId cannot appear in two operations
  • group cannot be empty. At least one attribute must be presented
  • attribute id is existing and unique for the asset type
  • if attribute assignment is marked as mandatory and NOT visible or editable default value is required
  • default value is validated against the attribute configuration
  • after all changes asset type must contain all system attributes and they should stay always mandatory
     [
         {
         "@type":"add",
         "groupName":
             {
                "en":"VIS 2"
             },
         "groupPosition": 16,
         "assignments":[
            {
                 "attributeId":7,
                 "visible":true,
                 "mandatory":false,
                 "editable": true,
                 "defaultValue":
                    {
                        "@type": "boolean",
                        "value": true
                    }
            },
            {
                 "attributeId": 9,
                 "visible": true,
                 "editable" : true,
                 "mandatory" : false,
                 "defaultValues": [
                     {
                         "@type": "text",
                         "value": "BG"
                     },
                     {
                         "@type": "text",
                         "value": "DE"
                     }]
            }]
         },
         {
             "@type":"update",
             "groupId": 102,
             "groupName":
                {
                    "en": "Group name"
                },
             "groupPosition": 12,
             "assignments":[
                 {
                     "attributeId":7,
                     "visible":true,
                     "mandatory":false,
                     "editable": true,
                     "defaultValue":
                        {
                             "@type": "boolean",
                             "value": true
                        }
                 },
                 {
                     "attributeId": 9,
                     "visible": true,
                     "editable" : true,
                     "mandatory" : false,
                     "defaultValues": [
                         {
                             "@type": "text",
                             "value": "BG"
                         },
                         {
                             "@type": "text",
                             "value": "DE"
                         }]
             }]
         },
         {
             "@type":"delete",
             "groupId": 102
         }
     ]
__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_ORGANISATION_MANAGE_ASSET_TYPES

post.description:
Creates download links for the assets specified within the request. If the assets have a license specified that license has to be confirmed by specifying its ID.

/rest/mp/assets/downloadLinks

__Available Since:__ 13.0.0 __Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

requestBody.description:
list of json representation of AssetDownloadLinkRequestParameter 
    [
    {
        "asset": {
            "id": 74668
        },
        "download_scheme": {
            "id": 5
        },
        "download_version": "LATEST",
        "license_confirmation": {
            "license": {
                "id": 13
            }
        },
        "language": "en"
    },
    {
        "asset": {
          "id": 74667
        },
        "download_scheme": {
          "id": 157
        },
        "download_version": "FIXED",
        "language": "en"
    }
    ]
  • asset
    • id (Integer) - asset id
  • download_scheme id (Integer) - download scheme id
  • download_version (String) - One of the VersionStrategy
    • "FIXED" - creates link to current latest version of the asset at the moment of the link creation.
    • "LATEST" - creates link to current latest version of the asset at the moment of download.
    • "OFFICIAL" - creates link to current official version of the asset at the moment of download. If the asset hasn't official version nothing will be downloaded.
  • language (String) - An ISO 639 language code that will be used for result data. (If the language is not available in the system an error message is returned.)
  • license_confirmation (Optional) - license that has to be confirmed
    • license
      • id - id of the license that has to be confirmed

404.description: Asset id or download scheme id are not found in the system.

post.description:
This API endpoint provides links to assets by bypassing certain functionalities which are applied in the user interface like download approval, license restrictions or VDB. The caller is responsible to first check, whether a download of the asset in the current state and in the current use case is appropriate or not. The authenticated API user as well must have the proper rights to download the requested formats of this asset. The HTTP state provided gives indications in a case of an error.

/rest/mp/assets/downloadLinks/direct

__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

requestBody.description:
list of json representation of AssetDownloadLinkRequestParameter 
    [
    {
    "asset": {
    "id": 74668
    },
    "download_scheme": {
    "id": 5
    },
    "download_version": "LATEST",
    "license_confirmation": {
    "license": {
    "id": 13
    }
    },
    "language": "en"
    },
    {
    "asset": {
    "id": 74667
    },
    "download_scheme": {
    "id": 157
    },
    "download_version": "FIXED",
    "language": "en"
    }
    ]
  • asset
    • id (Integer) - asset id
  • download_scheme id (Integer) (Optional) - download scheme id. If not provided, original file is used
  • download_version (String) (Optional) - One of the VersionStrategy. If not provided FIXED is used.
    • "FIXED"
    • "LATEST"
    • "OFFICIAL"
  • language (String) (Optional)- An ISO 639 language code that will be used for result data. (If the language is not available in the system an error message is returned.) If not provided, the language of current user is used
  • license_confirmation (Optional) - license that has to be confirmed
    • license
      • id - id of the license that has to be confirmed

404.description: Asset id or download scheme id are not found in the system.

409.description: Asset cannot be downloaded because is in upload approval workflow and is not approved.

put.description:
Update already existing publication (expired, active, future one).
All publications must have at least 24 hours between publish from and publish to dates.
__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MANAGE_PUBLISHED_FILES

parameters.name: assetId
parameters.description: id of the asset

requestBody.description:
JSON holding required data for update. There are 4 update operation types:
  • publish - set expired or scheduled channel publication to active
    Mandatory fields: publishingChannelId(value is case-insensitive), renderingSchemeId
    Optional field: publishTo - if not specified its treated as infinity publication,
    licenseId is required for publications of assets that got license assigned.
                          {
                          "@type":"publish",
                          "publishingChannelId":"PUBLIC_LINKS",
                          "renderingSchemeId":16050,
                          "publishTo":"2019-12-17T11:49:21Z",
                          "licenseId":123
                      }
  • unpublish - set active channel publication to expired
                         {
                          "@type":"unpublish",
                          "publishingChannelId":"PUBLIC_LINKS"
                     }
  • edit - edit active channel publication
    Mandatory fields: publishingChannelId(value is case-insensitive), renderingSchemeId
    Optional field: publishTo - if not specified its treated as infinity publication,
    licenseId is required for publications of assets that got license assigned.
                          {
                          "@type":"edit",
                          "publishingChannelId":"PUBLIC_LINKS",
                          "renderingSchemeId":16050,
                          "publishTo":"2019-12-17T11:49:21Z",
                          "licenseId":123
                      }
  • schedule - schedule future publication of expired or scheduled channel publication
    Mandatory fields: publishingChannelId(value is case-insensitive), renderingSchemeId, publishFrom - must be in future
    Optional field: publishTo - if not specified its treated as infinity publication,
    licenseId is required for publications of assets that got license assigned.
                          {
                          "@type":"schedule",
                          "publishingChannelId":"PUBLIC_LINKS",
                          "renderingSchemeId":16050,
                          "publishFrom":"2019-12-18T15:54:22Z",
                          "publishTo":"2019-12-20T15:20:22Z",
                          "licenseId":123
                      }

404.description: There is id that does not exists (asset, publishing channel, rendering scheme

409.description: Trying to publish in more than one system channel, update of not existing publication, not confirmed license, not available rendering scheme

post.description:
Creates a task for conversion of a file. Results from this task can be retrieved using GET /rest/mp/v1.2/download/file-generation-task/{taskId} Returns an object containing the ID of the task POST /rest/mp/v1.2/file-generation-task Request fields:
  • @type (String, mandatory) - determines the type of the task. Currently only "published_asset" type is available. The type determines the rest of the fields.
    • published_asset - convert a published asset according to a rendering scheme
      • assetId (Integer, mandatory) - Id of the published asset to convert
      • versionNumber (Integer, mandatory) - Version of the asset to convert
      • renderingSchemeId (Integer, mandatory) - The rendering scheme, specifying the output file
Example request: 
     {
         "@type": "published_asset",
         "assetId": 77816,
         "versionNumber": 0,
         "renderingSchemeId": 5
     }
Example response: 
     {
        "id": "03090778-2e15-45c9-b7bc-25331eda0755"
     }
__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

requestBody.description: task dto of specific type (extends FileGenerationTaskRestDto)

400.description: When any of the mandatory parameters are missing or of invalid type

404.description: Any of the necessary entities (asset, version, etc.) specified by ID is missing.

409.description: Task can not be executed (e.g. rendering scheme is not applicable)

Executes saved filter and returns assets information and aggregations information over the filtered results. If a query parameter is set, it overrides the corresponding saved filter parameter. Saved filter properties "isModified" and "isValid" are set in the result to indicate if the current saved filter contains any invalid values and if user has modified the search criteria.

     Example:
     /rest/mp/search/saved-filters/15551/actions/execute
__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

parameters.name: savedFilterId
parameters.description: (Integer, Non-negative) - id of the filter to execute

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
json representation of SearchFiltersWrapperRestDto 
    {
    "searchFilters": [{
    "type": "FF_5",
    "value": [{
    "search": "5"
    }]
    },{
    "type": "FF_3",
    "value": [{
    "search": "3"
    }]
    }]
    }
  • type (String) - type of the filter
    • KEYWORD
    • STRUCTURED_KEYWORD_ID
    • THEME_ID
    • COLOR_SPACE
    • COUNTRY_ID
    • LANGUAGE_ID
    • SUFFIX
    • VDB_ID
    • RATING
    • LICENSE_TYPE
    • IS_CURRENTLY_PUBLISHED
    • FF_n where n = {1,2,3...n} (Example: FF_5)
  • value - array of value objects
    • search (String) - filter value

FILTER TYPE: COLOR_SPACE
VALUE: "CMYK", RGB, ...
FILTER TYPE: COUNTRY_ID
VALUE: "DE"
FILTER TYPE: RATING
VALUE: 1..5

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: (Integer) set results starting position ( pagination ) (Optional, Default: 0)

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description:
(String) An ISO 639 language code or language tag that will be used for result data. (Optional, Default:
current user language)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: (Integer) number of the returned results (Optional, Default: 100)

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: (String) search string

parameters.name: resultData
parameters.description:
(String) type of the result data
  • "bm" - thumbnail view (default)
  • "listview"

json representation of SortCriteriasWrapperRestDto (Optional) 
    [{
    "field": "TITLE",
    "order": "ASC",
    "missing": "1"
    }, {
    "field": "KEYWORD",
    "order": "DESC"
    }]
  • field (String) - name of the filter
    • _score (relevance)
    • UPLOAD_DATE - configurable
    • LAST_UPDATED
    • TITLE - configurable
    • FILE_SIZE - configurable
    • POPULARITY
    • RATING - configurable
  • order (String) - asc/desc
  • missing (String) (Optional, Default: null)- Sets the value when a field is missing. Can also be set to _last or _first to sort missing last or first respectively.

get.description:
Executes saved filter with compressed/encoded URL - url hash, which overrides the saved search url hash. Returns information if the saved filter search parameters are modified compared to the original.

/rest/mp/search/saved-filters/15551/url-hash/{compressedUrlHash}/actions/execute

     Example:
     /rest/mp/search/saved-filters/15551/url-hash/H4sIAAAAAAAAACssTS2qtC1JzS1QK84vKrFVNXVSNXdSNTJKy0zNSQHSqsaOQDLEM8THFcQzcgaS-UUpqUVwOcdgZ7hMbmZxcWZeOlzOEMQydwFJYjHV2zUy3D_IBYe5Lq64DM4rzckBmWrqopaWmVOSWgR2NpBXlFpcmlPikliSaJuTWVxSlplaDgDkPGwf4QAAAA/actions/execute
__Available Since:__ 23.2.1 __Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

parameters.name: savedFilterId
parameters.description: (Integer, Non-negative) - id of the saved filter to execute

parameters.name: url-hash
parameters.description: (String) - hash, containing the set of search parameters

get.description:
Returns all user specific views.
If the public parameter presents and it's true, then the result will contains only the public views. If it's omitted or false, the result will contains the user's views plus the public ones.
If the includeSystem parameter presents and it's true, then result will include the system view for the current user - either the organisational view by fallback or the system default view.
System views can be recognized as they does not have an owner.
/v1.1/search/saved-views?public={true|false}&includeSystem={true|false}
     Example:
     GET /rest/mp/v1.1/search/saved-views?public=false&includeSystem=true
__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

200.description: List of SavedView descriptions is returned.

post.description:
Creates a new Saved View. 
/v1.1/search/saved-views
     Example:
     POST /v1.1/search/saved-views

post.description:
Performs a search based on the input request. The request must follow the SearchSchemaRestDto returned
from the SmartSearchRestService#getMPSearchSchema(boolean) method.

__Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

parameters.name: useLanguageNamesResult
parameters.description:
(boolean, Optional, Default: true) Define languages format in the result. 'true' - language names, 'false' - language tags. request example 
     {
         "criteria": {
             "@type": "and",
             "subs": [
             {
             "@type": "in",
             "any": "true",
             "fields":
                 [
                    "themes.id"
                 ],
             "long_value":
                 [
                     264,
                     44
                 ]
             }]
         },
         "output": {
             "items": {
                 "fields":
                     [
                        "id"
                     ]
             },
             "aggregates":{
                 "count": {
                     "@type": "count",
                     "field": "averageRating"
                 }
             },
             "paging": {
                 "@type": "offset",
                 "limit": 25,
                 "offset": 0
             },
             "sorting":
             [
                 {
                     "@type": "field",
                     "asc": "false",
                     "field": "lastUpdatedTime"
                 }
            ]},
         "searchSchemaId": "asset"
     }
  • searchSchemaId (MANDATORY) - specifies the index, where the search will be performed. Currently the only supported index is asset (search for assets)
  • criteria (OPTIONAL) - specifies a criteria to be applied on the result set
    • @type (String, MANDATORY) - type of the criteria. The optional/mandatory properties of the criteria are determined by it's type. One of:
      • true - Used on boolean fields only! Only documents having the fields set to true will remain in the result set. Applicable properties: any, fields
      • false - Used on boolean fields only! Only documents having the fields set to false will remain in the result set. Applicable properties: any, fields
      • gt - Used on long, double, date and time fields only! Only documents having fields set to greater value than the specified will remain in the result set. Applicable properties: any, fields, long_value, double_value, date_value, time_value
      • ge - Used on long, double, date and time fields only! Only documents having fields set to greater or equal value than the specified will remain in the result set. Applicable properties: any, fields, long_value, double_value, date_value, time_value
      • lt - Used on long, double, date and time fields only! Only documents having fields set to value that is less than the specified will remain in the result set. Applicable properties: any, fields, long_value, double_value, date_value, time_value
      • le - Used on long, double, date and time fields only! Only documents having fields set to value less than or equal to the specified will remain in the result set. Applicable properties: any, fields, long_value, double_value, date_value, time_value
      • eq - Only documents having fields set to the exact value specified will remain in the result set. Applicable properties: any, fields, long_value, double_value, date_value, time_value, text_value, langs
      • in - Only documents having fields set to one of the values specified will remain in the result set. Applicable properties: any, fields, long_value, double_value, date_value, time_value, text_value, langs. For this criteria the properties long_value, double_value, date_value, time_value, text_value are arrays instead of single values.
      • match - Only documents having fields that contain words CONTAINING all of the words in the criteria will remain in the result set. E.g. searching "page" will match documents containing the word "page" and documents containing the word "pages". Applicable properties: any, fields, value, fieldsBoost, langs
      • exact_match - Only documents having fields that contain words that EXACTLY MATCH all of the words in the criteria will remain in the result set. E.g. searching "page" will match documents containing the word "page" but won't match documents containing the word "pages". Applicable properties: any, fields, value, fieldsBoost, langs
      • object - Applies sub criteria to the fields of the specified object field. Applicable properties: field, criteria
      • object_set - Applies sub criteria to the fields of the specified object set field. Applicable properties: field, criteria
      • missing - Only documents that DO NOT have the fields set will remain in the result set. Applicable properties: any, fields
      • or - Only documents conforming to ANY of the sub criteria will remain in the result set. Applicable properties: subs
      • and - Only documents conforming to ALL of the sub criteria will remain in the result set. Applicable properties: subs
      • not - Only documents NOT conforming to the sub criteria will remain in the result set. Applicable properties: subs
    • field (String, MANDATORY) - Specifies the field to which the object/object_set sub-criteria should be applied.
    • fields (String array, MANDATORY) - specifies to which fields the criteria should be applied. Must NOT be empty.
    • any (boolean, OPTIONAL, defaults to TRUE) - specifies whether ANY (logical OR) of the fields in the fields property should match the criteria or ALL (logical AND) should match.
    • value (String, MANDATORY) - specifies the words to be matched against the document fields.
    • langs (String array, OPTIONAL) - Specifies the languages to which the multilanguage field criteria should be applied. Defaults to the query langs
    • fieldsBoost (String->Number associative array, OPTIONAL) - Specifies the relevance of the match when multiple fields are specified in match/exact_match criteria.
    • long_value (Integer) - Specifies the long value to compare long fields against. In the case of in criteria, this field is an array, rather than a single value. Mandatory when comparing long fields.
    • double_value (Number) - Specifies the double value to compare double fields against. In the case of in criteria, this field is an array, rather than a single value. Mandatory when comparing double fields.
    • date_value (Date) - Specifies the date value to compare date fields against. In the case of in criteria, this field is an array, rather than a single value. Mandatory when comparing date fields.
    • time_value (Time) - Specifies the time value to compare time fields against. In the case of in criteria, this field is an array, rather than a single value. Mandatory when comparing time fields.
    • text_value (String) - Specifies the text value to compare text fields against. In the case of in criteria, this field is an array, rather than a single value. Mandatory when comparing text fields.
    • subs (Criteria array, MANDATORY) - Specifies the sub criteria for a composite criteria (and, or). Should contain at least two items.
    • criteria (Criteria, MANDATORY) - Specifies the single sub criteria for composite UNARY criteria (object, object_set, not).
  • output (OPTIONAL) - describes the output (result) that the client wants to receive
    • lang (String, OPTIONAL) - The language for single language text loadables. Defaults to the current user's language.
    • langs (String array, OPTIONAL) - The languages for multilanguage loadables. Defaults to langs property of the query.
    • paging (OPTIONAL) - Describes what part of the result set should be returned. Defaults to the first 25 results.
      • @type (String, MANDATORY) - the type of paging to apply. Currently only offset is supported.
      • offset (Integer, OPTIONAL) - the offset from the first result. Defaults to 0.
      • limit (Integer, OPTIONAL) - the maximum number of results. Defaults to 25.
    • sorting (Sort item objects array, OPTIONAL) - describes how the result set should be sorted.
      • @type (String, MANDATORY) - the type of sorting. One of: field, relevance
      • asc (Boolean, OPTIONAL) - specifies whether the items should be sorted in ascending order. Defaults to true
      • field (String, MANDATORY) - Items will be sorted by this field's value. Applicable with field sort items only.
      • lang (String, OPTIONAL) - The language to use when sorting by multilanguage field. Defaults to the /output/lang value.
      • setAggregation (String, OPTIONAL) - Defines which value to be assumed when the field is a set (e.g. text_set, long_set...). Defaults to "max". One of:
        • max - The maximum value in the set will be assumed.
        • min - The minimum value in the set will be assumed.
        • avg - The average value of the items in the set will be assumed. Only applicable to long_set, double_set fields
        • avg - The sum of the items in the set will be assumed. Only applicable to long_set, double_set fields
      • missing (String, OPTIONAL) - Defines the strategy for sorting items that do NOT have values for the field specified. Defaults to "last". One of:
        • first - Documents with missing values will be ordered BEFORE the ones with values.
        • last - Documents with missing values will be ordered AFTER the ones with values.
        • value - Documents with missing values will assume the value (either text_value, long_value, double_value, date_value or time_value depending on the field's type) of the respective property.
      • text_value (String) - The text value to be assumed for documents with missing field value. Mandatory when missing is set to value and the field is text field
      • long_value (Integer) - The long value to be assumed for documents with missing field value. Mandatory when missing is set to value and the field is long field
      • double_value (Number) - The double value to be assumed for documents with missing field value. Mandatory when missing is set to value and the field is double field
      • date_value (Date) - The date value to be assumed for documents with missing field value. Mandatory when missing is set to value and the field is date field
      • time_value (Time) - The time value to be assumed for documents with missing field value. Mandatory when missing is set to value and the field is time field
    • items (OPTIONAL) - describes a single item (document) in the result set. The description follows the loadable section of the schema.
      • fields (String array, OPTIONAL) - specifies which fields should be loaded. If a field is object or object set it will be loaded with all of it's fields.
      • objects (ObjectSet item array, OPTIONAL) - specifies which properties of an object field should be loaded. The name (String, MANDATORY) property specifies the name of the object property. This object also has all of the properties in the /output/items object.
      • objectSets (ObjectSet item array, OPTIONAL) - specifies which properties of an object set field should be loaded. The name (String, MANDATORY) property specifies the name of the object set property. This object also has all of the properties in the /output/items object.
    • aggregates (String->Object associative array, OPTIONAL) - list of aggregations to be calculated. The string value specifies the aggregation's name.
      • field (String, MANDATORY) - The field over which the aggregation will be performed
      • @type (String, MANDATORY) - The type of aggregation to be performed. Each type of aggregation may introduce additional properties. One of:
        • object - Container for aggregations to be performed on fields of an object field. The subAggs property describes the aggregations that will be performed on the object's fields. It is MANDATORY and follows the exact same schema as /output/aggregates
        • object_set - Container for aggregations to be performed on fields of an object set field. The subAggs property describes the aggregations that will be performed on the object set's fields. It is MANDATORY and follows the exact same schema as /output/aggregates
        • sum - Sums all values of the field. Only applicable to long and double fields.
        • count - Counts the number of documents found.
        • avg - Finds the average value of the field. Only applicable to long and double fields.
        • max - Finds the maximum value of the field. Only applicable to long, double, date and time fields.
        • min - Finds the minimum value of the field. Only applicable to long, double, date and time fields.
        • group_range - Splits documents in buckets according to the range in which the value of the field falls. subAggs are performed on each bucket. This aggregation introduces the following properties:
          • subAggs (MANDATORY) - The aggregations to perform on each bucket. Follows the same schema as /outputs/aggregates
          • long_ranges (String->Object associative array) - Describes the buckets to split the documents in. String property names the bucket. The object's from and to properties describe the lower and upper (inclusive) bounds of the range. One of them may be missing. Mandatory when the field is of type long
          • double_ranges (String->Object associative array) - Describes the buckets to split the documents in. String property names the bucket. The object's from and to properties describe the lower and upper (inclusive) bounds of the range. One of them may be missing. Mandatory when the field is of type double
          • date_ranges (String->Object associative array) - Describes the buckets to split the documents in. String property names the bucket. The object's from and to properties describe the lower and upper (inclusive) bounds of the range. One of them may be missing. Mandatory when the field is of type date
          • time_ranges (String->Object associative array) - Describes the buckets to split the documents in. String property names the bucket. The object's from and to properties describe the lower and upper (inclusive) bounds of the range. One of them may be missing. Mandatory when the field is of type time
        • groups - Splits documents in buckets for each unique value of the field. subAggs are performed on each bucket. Certain values can be included/excluded. When include values are set, the result will contain only buckets for values that match the respective property. When exclude values are set, the result will contain only buckets for values that do NOT match the respective property. This aggregation introduces the following properties:
          • subAggs (MANDATORY) - The aggregations to perform on each bucket. Follows the same schema as /outputs/aggregates
          • includeRegex (String, OPTIONAL) - A java regular expression. Only buckets for values matching this regex will be included. Applicable to text fields only!
          • excludeRegex (String, OPTIONAL) - A java regular expression. Only buckets for values NOT matching this regex will be included. Applicable to text fields only!
          • text_include (String array, OPTIONAL) - Only buckets for values that are present in this array will be included. Applicable to text fields only!
          • text_exclude (String array, OPTIONAL) - Only buckets for values that are NOT present in this array will be included. Applicable to text fields only!
          • long_include (Long array, OPTIONAL) - Only buckets for values that are present in this array will be included. Applicable to long fields only!
          • long_exclude (Long array, OPTIONAL) - Only buckets for values that are NOT present in this array will be included. Applicable to long fields only!
          • double_include (Double array, OPTIONAL) - Only buckets for values that are present in this array will be included. Applicable to double fields only!
          • double_exclude (Double array, OPTIONAL) - Only buckets for values that are NOT present in this array will be included. Applicable to double fields only!
          • lang (String) - The language to be used for multilanguage fields. Mandatory when field is multilanguage.
          • orderByGroup (boolean, OPTIONAL, Default: true) - When true, groups in result will be ordered by the group's name. When true, groups in result will be ordered by the group's value.
          • orderAsc (boolean, OPTIONAL, Default: true) - Specifies whether the groups should be ordered in ascending or descending order
          • maxGroups (Integer, OPTIONAL) - The maximum number of groups that will be present in the result. If not set, the number of groups is NOT limited.

get.description:
Loads transcoded videos in Transcoding Queue Table.

/rest/mp/transcoded-videos

     Example:
     /rest/mp/transcoded-videos?sort=assetTitle&dir=ASC&start=1&limit=1
By default loads 50 results, sorted by modification date (DESC) and transcoded state (ASC).
If no sorting direction is specified, the default is DESC.
If no sorting field is specified, the default sorting is by modification date (DESC) and transcoding state (ASC)
If Query parameter is wrong, returns status 400
__Available Since:__ 20.0.1 __Security Roles Allowed:__ PIMEDIA_DATABASE_MODULE_ACCESS

parameters.description: (Integer, Optional) select first index for generated query result data (start from 0). Must be  less than transcoded files count. (Default: 0)
